sense.name: utter with vibrating vocal chords
sense.examples: I didn't want to vocalize my lingering worries. Infants and toddlers are not inclined to vocalize on request. Students are allowed to vocalize without teacher assistance. I didn't vocalize it much. Ms. Julia encouraged Millie's efforts to babble and vocalize. I was full of ideas and opinions I couldn't wait to vocalize.

sense.name: sing each note in a scale or melody with the same vowel
sense.examples: The singer would sometimes vocalize the melody by using the sound, " hooo " The young lady strolling along in front of them was softly vocalizing.

sense.name: pronounce as a vowel
sense.examples: Should Turkish poetry be vocalized? Arabic poetry is vocalized in the West and the vowel signs help students.

sense.name: express clearly
sense.examples: He wanted to clearly vocalize his opinion.
